text:
Mary-Kate Olsen tied the knot with Olivier Sarkozy in November 2015, and now the former child star has given a rare interview about married life.

Rex Features

Speaking to The Edit, in which she and twin sister Ashley pose for a photoshoot, Mary-Kate said: "I think we’re lucky [working hard] comes quite naturally for us. We don’t need so much time to sit and think and ponder.

Advertisement

"But then I have a husband, two step-kids and a life; I have to go home and cook dinner. I run on the weekend."

She continued: "You find the thing that helps you relax and if you don’t have it, you have to look for it. Or you get burned out and then you’re not productive."

Back in November 2015, Mary-Kate got married to her 47-year-old beau in a secret ceremony. According to reports, the 30-year-old former child actress tied the knot with her French banker beau of three years, Olivier Sarkozy, at an intimate Manhattan ceremony.

Mary-Kate now lives in New York with her family in a $6.25 million townhouse.

Advertisement

It appears that congratulations are in order for Mary-Kate Olsen and Olivier Sarkozy after they got married this weekend.

The pair, who got engaged in February 2014, married in front of around 50 guests in an outdoor garden at a private residence before the party moved indoors, where the newlyweds and their family and friends dined.

Getty Images

According to a source, party decor consisted of "bowls and bowls filled with cigarettes, and everyone smoked the whole night."

Advertisement

Lovely.

As for Mary-Kate's engagement ring, Mary-Kate Olsen first flashed it at Paris Fashion Week back in 2014.

At the Louis Vuitton show, the designer flashed an unusual thick gold ring with a large center diamond. The ring was also spotted in New York earlier this week.

PacificCoastNews.com

Advertisement

Various jewellery experts speculated over what the ring actually is. Vashi Dominguez told the Daily Mail that the gem could be a three-carat oval cut opal, whilst Zaven Ghanimian, Marketing Director of Simon G. Jewellery, told E! News that the ring "appears to be an 18-carat yellow gold vintage design. The round, oval center stone is either a rough-cut gray or white diamond."

But Style Caster are reporting that the ring is in fact, a vintage Cartier creation bought at a Sotheby's auction for $81,000. Dating from 1953, the vintage choice features European-cut diamond clocks framed by 16 sapphires, and the petals are set with single-cut diamonds.
